name: Dental chair
description: A specialized chair designed for use in dental procedures. Dental chairs have adjustable height, backrest, and armrests to ensure patient comfort and provide easy access for the dentist.

name: Dental drill
description: A high-speed hand-held tool used to remove decay and reshape teeth during a variety of dental procedures, including fillings, crowns, and bridges.

name: Digital X-ray machine
description: A machine that uses digital technology to produce detailed images of a patient's teeth and gums for diagnostic purposes. Digital X-rays use significantly less radiation than traditional X-rays and provide faster results.

name: Intraoral camera
description: A small camera that allows dentists to take images of the inside of a patient's mouth to aid in diagnosis and treatment planning.

name: Curing light
description: A handheld light source used to harden dental materials such as composite resin during fillings and other restorative procedures.

name: Ultrasonic scaler
description: A handheld tool that uses high-frequency vibrations to remove tartar and plaque buildup from teeth during cleanings.

name: Surgical handpiece
description: A specialized dental drill used during surgical procedures such as extractions and implant placement.

name: Implant motor
description: A specialized dental drill used during implant placement procedures.

name: Endodontic handpiece
description: A specialized dental drill used during root canal procedures to remove infected or damaged tissue from inside the tooth.

name: Air abrasive
description: A tool that uses compressed air and fine particles to remove surface stains, decay, and other dental debris from teeth.

name: Cone beam computed tomography
description: A specialized X-ray technique that produces detailed three-dimensional images of a patient's teeth, jaw, and other craniofacial structures. CBCT is often used for implant planning and other complex procedures.

name: Intraoral scanner
description: A handheld device used to take digital impressions of a patient's teeth and gums for use in restorative procedures such as crowns and bridges.

name: Air water syringe
description: A handheld tool used to rinse and dry teeth during a variety of dental procedures.

name: Dental fiber optic handpiece
description: A specialized dental drill that uses fiber optic technology to provide better illumination and visualization during procedures.

name: Dental sterilization unit
description: A machine used to sterilize dental instruments and equipment to prevent the spread of infection.

name: Ultraviolet sterilizer
description: A device used to sterilize dental instruments and equipment using ultraviolet light.

name: Dental air compressor
description: A machine that provides compressed air for use in a variety of dental tools.

name: Dental amalgamator
description: A machine used to mix and blend dental amalgam for use in fillings.

name: Ultrasonic cleaner
description: A machine that uses high-frequency sound waves to remove dirt, debris, and other contaminants from dental instruments and equipment.

name: Nitrous oxide sedation system
description: A system used to deliver nitrous oxide gas to patients to help them relax and alleviate anxiety during dental procedures.

name: Dental laser
description: A specialized tool used in a variety of dental procedures, including periodontal therapy and surgical procedures.

name: Cavitron
description: A specialized ultrasonic scaler used during teeth cleaning procedures to remove tartar and plaque buildup.

name: Intraoral radiography
description: A specialized X-ray technique that produces detailed images of the inside of a patient's mouth for diagnostic purposes.

name: Dental articulator
description: A device used to hold dental models in the correct position to aid in the fabrication of restorations such as crowns and bridges.

name: Dental torque wrench
description: A specialized tool used to measure and control the tightening force applied to dental implants.

name: Dental syringe
description: A handheld tool used to inject local anesthesia during dental procedures.

name: Dental lathe
description: A machine used to shape and polish dental restorations such as dentures and crowns.

name: Dental polishing unit
description: A machine used to polish dental restorations and remove surface stains from teeth.

name: Electric pulp tester
description: A handheld device used to diagnose the health of a tooth's nerve by measuring the response to small electrical impulses.

name: Dental curing unit
description: A handheld light source used to harden dental materials such as composite resin during fillings and other restorative procedures.

name: Dental elevator
description: A surgical instrument used to loosen teeth before extraction.

name: Forceps
description: A surgical instrument used to grip and extract teeth.

name: Orthodontic pliers
description: Specialty pliers used for adjusting brackets, archwires, and elastic bands during orthodontic treatment.

name: Articulator
description: A mechanical device used to simulate jaw movements and occlusal relationships in dental restorations.

name: Whitening lamp
description: A specialized light used to accelerate the whitening process during dental bleaching procedures.

name: Nitrous oxide sedation system
description: A system used to administer nitrous oxide (laughing gas) to patients to help them relax and reduce pain and anxiety during dental procedures.

name: Air abrasive unit
description: A device that projects a stream of abrasive particles and compressed air to remove surface stains and deposits from teeth.

name: Orthognathic trays
description: Custom-fitted trays used to position and stabilize the jaws during orthodontic treatment.

name: Oral cancer detector
description: A device used to screen for oral cancer by shining a special light onto the oral tissues to identify abnormal cells and lesions.

name: Fluoride varnish
description: A concentrated fluoride treatment applied to teeth to strengthen enamel and prevent cavities.
